examples.description: Given the current date is 2016-04-06 -> And a UK Limited Company which was started on 2015-01-01 -> And the company is VAT registered from 2015-01-01 -> And they have GBP bank account -> And they have EUR bank account -> And they have USD bank account -> And they are viewing the IR35 report for the 2015/16 tax year -> And the company is not eligible for employment allowance -> Given an IR35 project -> And exchange rates of -> And an IR35 project in USD -> And a related unbilled Expense for 200.00 inc 24.72 VAT on 2015-04-20 -> And a related unbilled Bank Payment for 200.00 inc 20% VAT on 2015-05-20 -> And a related unbilled Expense for 120.00 inc 20% VAT on 2015-06-20 -> And a related unbilled Expense for 120.00 inc 20% VAT on 2015-07-20 -> And a related Invoice Payment for $10000.00 + 20% VAT on 2015-04-25 -> And a related Invoice Payment for 6400.00 + 20% VAT on 2015-05-25 -> And a related Invoice Payment for 6400.00 + 20% VAT on 2015-06-25 -> And a related Invoice Payment for 6400.00 + 20% VAT on 2015-07-25 -> And the director is over 21 years old -> And the director uses the normal Director method for calculating NI -> And the director gets paid 6224.7333 on 2015-05-06 -> And the director gets paid 5473.93 on 2015-06-06 -> And the director gets paid 5254.83 on 2015-07-06 -> When viewing the IR35 Report -> Then the deemed payments should be
